subject: Dead Sensor
caption: Dead sensor at I2;;;;Waveform showing the time at which this element ceased to record ground motions
description: The sensor at the I2 element died late on 2020-11-30 and remains dead through the end of the reporting period. Added a plot pinpointing the problem onset on 2020-11-30.

subject: Dead broadband sensor
caption: Last time period when sensor was recording ground motions;;;;Data returned but as digitizer noise
description: All 3 channels of the broadband sensor at FSAH1 are not recording ground motions. We have approached Randy about this sensor but it is not resolved. This ticket remains open. I looked at bit more closely at this. Apparently, ground motions were recorded up until 2019-11-28, at which point there was an outage. The data returned on 2020-01-16, but only as digitizer noise. I have an email out to Randy to see if we can update out metadata with an end date of 2019-11-28 for this sensor.

subject: Dead broadband sensor
description: Keeping this ticket open for a dead broadband sensor. Added the 'dead' threshold, based on the 'dead_channel_gsn' metric. Looked more closely at when this problem began. Looks like data went out around 2019-11-28T03:35:00 and came back as digitizer noise on 2020-01-16T01:30:00. I have an email out to Randy to see if this sensor should be closed in our metadata.

subject: Dead sensor on the I2 element
caption: Waveform showing time that the I2 element ceased recording ground motions;;;;Spectra showing dead sensor at I2
description: The I2 element appears to have a dead sensor. Problem appears to have started late on 2020-11-30. Added an image pinpointing time of problem onset.

subject: Elevated noise on broadband
caption: Spectra computed with old WATC metadata;;;;Spectra computed with corrected WATC metadata;;;;Spectra computed with IRIS metadata
description: All 3 broadband channels exceeded the 'hiAmp' threshold. This issues has been corrected in our metadata inventory and will soon be installed. However, the ticket will remain open until the station passes thresholds. Metadata has been updated for the 2020-12-14 period. This has improved noise spectra, but noise remains elevated enough to still exceed thresholds. Ticket will remain open pending a discussion with the A-Team.

subject: Gaps
caption: Waveform showing typical gap pattern for CDF channels.;;;;Daily number of gaps for the ADKI.01 element. Pattern in similar for all elements.;;;;Number of gaps affects percent_availability for all elements.
description: All elements of the ADKI array exhibit large numbers of gaps in the CDF channels for the entire reporting period. Daily number of gaps appear to spike on 2020-11-20 and 2020-11-21. These gaps continue, but metric generation for these channels will cease until they can by down-sampled.

subject: Gaps
caption: Plot showing the large number of gaps on 2020-12-15;;;;Gaps on 2020-12-15 were large enough to affect data availability. All C elements were affected.;;;;Daily percent availability showing gaps continuing into the most recent reporting period;;;;
description: There were a large number of gaps at all C elements at I52 on 2020-12-15. This problem did not affect the H elements at I52. Re-opened this ticket as there were large numbers of gaps again for all C elements during thir reporting period. H elements remain unaffected.

subject: Gaps
caption: Comparison of IRIS-downloaded vs WATC-downloaded waveforms for ELK.BHZ showing gaps in WATC data but not in IRIS;;;;Daily number of gaps on BHZ. Similar numbers for all components
description: All broadband channels at US.ELK exhibit high numbers of gaps for the entire reporting period. The same data from the IRIS FDSN do not exhibit gaps. There appears to be a communication error at some point. Gaps continuing through the current reporting period.

subject: Gaps and Outage
caption: ;;;;Plot showing large numbers of gaps at the H1 element on 2020-12-16;;;;Large numbers of gaps on 2020-12-16 precipitated a drop in availability for the H1 and H2 elements;;;;Gaps on DLL02
description:
There were numerous gaps on elements 1 and 2 for the reporting period. Gaps and outages for elements 1 and 2 continued into this reporting period with large numbers of gaps occurring on 2020-12-16.

Gaps are continuing in reporting period 2020-12-21 with low data percentage availability (below 40 percent) for element 2 on 2020-12-23. 
Gaps Continuing into the new reporting period on these elements. There was also an array-wide outage on 2020-12-31, but this appears to be a distinct issue (see separate ticket).

subject: Gaps and low availability DLL H3
caption: Gaps at DLL with low percentage availability on 2020-12-22.
description: DLL had gaps throughout the reporting period 2020-12-21 with a very low percentage of data availability on 2020-12-22.

subject: High Noise
caption: Elevated noise on 2020-12-29;;;;Wind speed at I58H2 showing wind event
description: This element was noisy on 2020-12-29. The other 3 elements exhibited noise but at lower amplitudes. This noise appears to be associated with a wind event.

subject: High amplitudes
caption: High amp I4 ;;;;High amp I5;;;;High amp I6
description:
High amplitudes were flagged for FSAH4.I[4-6]. Likely a wind event?
These elements continue to be noisy into the current reporting period. Keeping the ticket open and changing the status to "In Progress".

subject: Low amplitude
caption: SHE spectra on 2020-12-21;;;;SHZ spectra on 2020-12-21;;;;
description: Low amplitudes flagged for entire week 2020-12-21 to 2020-12-27

subject: Malfunctioning weather station at FSAH2.M1
caption: Waveform showing digitizer noise from the met channels;;;;M1 waveforms with sensitivities removed. Not flagged.
description:
Continued dead channels for the met sensor at this station. 

Update: Not dead but continues to have issues. This was seen from manual inspection (quarg did not flag).

subject: Metadata issue
caption: Broadband elevated noise continues;;;;High amplitude on BH1 on 2020-12-24;;;;Possible metadata issue (high amp not flagged)
description:
Metadata issue known from the start of this reporting period (but is seen in previous week). 

Continuing to see metadata issue for entire reporting period (2020-12-21 to 2020-12-27) for BH1 but only on partial period (2020-12-21 to 2020-12-25) on BH2. High amplitudes were flagged on 2020-12-24 for all channels (higher than seen on previous day).

subject: Metadata problems
caption: PDF showing mid-period noise dipping below the nlnm;;;;;;;;
description:
The noise spectra for the 3-component short-period sensor at this site show significant mid-period energy below the noise model, indicating that there may be a problem with the response. Also, azimuth and dip are undefined for the vertical channel.  
The orientation data has been updated in GMP. We should be able to close this ticket next week.

subject: Noise
caption: Odd spectra from the BHZ channel on 2020-12-28 ;;;;Filtered waveforms showing large number of spikes on the vertical channel
description: There was elevated noise on the vertical channel of the ELK broadband on 2020-12-28. It appears to have gone back to normal by the end of the reporting period.

subject: Noise on Broadband
caption: Continuing to see mass recenter and calibration change.;;;;Mass recentering continues;;;;;;;;MRC's continue
description:
Re-opening this ticket as the 'hiAmp' threshold was exceeded on 2020-11-15. While there continues to be elevated mid-period noise, threshold exceedance usually seems to be associated with mass recenters. There has been once a week for the last 2 weeks. I'll keep this ticket open and keep an eye on the mrcs going forward. Re-opened this ticket as there have been continued mass recenters that exceeded the hiamp threshold. SHEM did not break the hiAmp threshold this reporting period. However, because it has exhibited consistent mass recenters, I will leave this ticket open for at least one more week.

Update: Continue to see mass recenters on 2020-12-22 for BHN and BHZ. 
These continue into the current period.

subject: Outage
caption: Plot of daily percent availability showing low availability on 2020-12-31;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
description: There was low data availabilty for all elements of DLL on 2020-12-31. Data appeared to be back by 2021-01-03.

subject: Transient Noise
caption: I5 high amplitude;;;;I5 high amplitude;;;;I6 high amplitude ;;;;PDF showing high-frequency noise continuing into the most recent reporting period
description:
Transient noise on FSAH2.I[4-6] on 2020-12-23. Possibly wind? 
High-frequency noise continues into the current reporting period. Now visible on all elements except for I2 (dead sensor). Adding elements 1 and 3 to ticket and changing status to "in progress".

subject: Transient Noise
caption: Spectra showing transient noise;;;;High amp I3 on 2020-12-23;;;;High amp on I4 on 2020-12-23;;;;Noise continuing into the latest reporting period
description:
These elements continue to experience transient noise. Particularly on the 2020-11-30. No transient noise this period.

Elements continue to be flagged for high amplitudes on 2020-12-23.

Same issue continues into this reporting period.

subject: Transient Noise
caption: ;;;;Spectra showing elevated noise at high frequencies;;;;Waveform showing transient noise at the I4 element;;;;High amp spectra on 2020-12-23;;;;High-frequecy noise continuing into the current reporting period
description:
Elements 3 and 4 exceeded the hiamp threshold on 2020-11-27. This noise was apparent at other FSA sites and is most likely associated with a wind event. Continued transient noise on 2020-12-15 and 2020-12-20.

High amplitudes continue on elements 3 and 4 on 2020-12-23 and on element 4 on 2020-12-24.

Noise continued into the current reporting period for these 2 elements.

subject: Noise characteristics at NVAR
caption: Daily percent above noise model at NV11.SHZ for the reporting period;;;;PDF plot showing elevated noise at NV11.SHZ;;;;;;;;
description: All short-periods seismometers of the NVAR array continue to exceed the 'hiAmp' threshold. Identified issues in our metadata. Ticket will remain open until these issues are addressed.
